Description: old.Amuletic string: the beads are dark-purple and bright-blue glazed composition discs, strung in alternating sections, and one green glazed composition cylinder. The aegis amulet is of silver; the 'nebti'-amulet (vulture and uraeus on baskets) and a few tiny ring beads are of gold foil. Both of the amulets are very thin; the 'nebti' has incised cross-hatching on the basket and roughly incised details on the vulture and uraeus. The aegis has no details.
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: beads (1926,0728.168 & 1926,0728.170 & 1926,0728.171 & 1926,0728.172 & 1926,0728.174), pendant with beads (1926,0728.175), seal with beads (1926,0728.169). Bibliography: H. Frankfort in 'Journal of Egyptian Archaeology' 16 (1930), 218. briefly refers to this burial; C. Andrews, 'Amulets of Ancient Egypt' (London 1994), fig. 62.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (256)
